body.p:
Father of man, whose providence is ever watchful over the
works of they Creatures, be with us this day in our assembling for the
glorification of thy blessed name. Behold! with insufficient strength
and few in number we present ourselves in they presence not relying
on our might and our wisdom, but on thy goodness and on thy aid
to perfect what we so feebly begin. We feel deeply our unworthiness
to assume the task of becoming the teachers of thy word; we are
penetrated with the painful consciousness that the best among us needs
correction, that the widest requires yet more instruction; yet still be Then
with us in the hours we devote to the diffusion of thy faith, teach
the ignorant how to expound thy law, and render the feeble tongue
eloquent so that we may see blissful fruits to ripening from our exertions,
and thy kingdom taking deep root in hearts and the seat of ignorance
and vanity. Make us and our scholars alive to the consolations which
flow from thy revealed word, the unsearchable streams of knowledge
which are diffused over the world through thy spirit which thou didst
spread over thy people when they stood trembling before thy glory which
was made manifest before their eyes on your Sinai, when thy power
had humbled their oppressors and broken the chains of their servitude.
Fill us with gratitude for the many benefits which Israel has ere obtain
ed at thy hands, for the many redemptions which so ? us from
destruction when strangers to thy law rose up to blot out our name
from the face of the earth; and O! bad enchantment and persuasion
to our words that we may succeed in ? the young scions
of thy household who come to us for instruction with a firm resolu
? true and faithful to thee, O God! who hast been so benefi-
cent towards their fathers, who have preserved for them up to this day

the treasures which no gold, nor pearl can purchase, which no earthly
possessions can equal in value. For great, Almighty Father! That we and our pupils may
have a full appreciation of what thy teaching has been to us, that it
alone shielded us when the arrows of misfortune flow thick around
us, when the burning sun in mid-day seemed to us shorn of his
rags and warmth, when the skies appeared to us clothed in black
ness; when all joy was fled, and destruction threatened to engulf us
for ever. Let us understand it fully, that it was not our perseverance,
our obduracy of character against which ? warns of misfortune
exhausted their rage in vain; but that it was the strength of they word and
the panoply of thy covenant which dwells within us, which made us strong
and unconquerable, which imbued us with the resistance to the worlds assaults
which the strangers have beheld with astonishment, which our opponents have
failed to explain, regarding it, as we do, in the light of a manifestation of
thy miraculous power.

Do this, for the sake of thy holiness, for the sake of thy glory which dwells
in Israel; so that our sons and daughters may be drawn to thy worship,
firmly clinging to thy law, as their tree of life, under the branches of
bad clime they can find shelter and safety; and vouchsafe that what
we commence this day in fear and trembling very branch out into a
nursery of righteousness and knowledge, wherein? mercy may issue to
labour for the spread of thy kingdom, as messengers of blessed tidings to
many yet unborn. By this, O Father! shall we recognize that we
have not laboured toiled for naught, and that our scarce offered in humanity,
has been received in favour before thy mercy's throne. And let us
beseech thee also, that thou wagest plant in our hearts brotherly
love and mutual forbearance, that we support each other's pious coun-
sels and travel ?tedly on that road which leads to thy happy mansions,
where they are to dwell, who have here on earth fulfilled thy will.

Strengthen our virtuous inclination that we may subdue the evil which
is within us, above all the spirit of domination, arrogance and self-
suffiency? which misleads mortals to exalt themselves above their fellows
who like them are the objects of thy care, like them the children of thy
household. And thus let us in humility approach thy presence, ready
to labour for thy glory on whatere station Thou wilt assign us, and
thus shall we know that we have found favour in thy eyes and that our
prayer has been accepted in mercy.

Yea bless our undertaking, not for our sake, but for the sake
of the covenant Thou madest with our fathers, Abraham, Isaac
& Jacob, that there wouldst be a God with them and their seed
for ever. Amen.
